Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Quesadillas

Jump to Recipe

If you're on the hunt for a delicious and easy weeknight meal, look no further than these Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Quesadillas! This recipe is perfect for busy families or anyone who wants to enjoy a tasty dish without spending hours in the kitchen. By using a slow cooker, you can let the flavors meld beautifully while you go about your day. With just a handful of ingredients, including tender boneless, skinless chicken breasts, zesty salsa, and your choice of shredded cheese, these quesadillas are packed with flavor and sure to please your taste buds. Plus, they're incredibly versatile—feel free to add your favorite toppings like sour cream and fresh cilantro for that extra touch! Whether you're hosting a casual get-together or simply craving a comforting meal, these Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Quesadillas are a fantastic choice that everyone will love.

Ingredients

boneless, skinless chicken breasts

For best results, use fresh chicken breasts instead of frozen, as they will cook more evenly. If you want to substitute, you can use boneless, skinless chicken thighs for a richer flavor and more moisture.

salsa

Choose a salsa that matches your preferred spice level. You can also make your own by blending tomatoes, onions, jalapeños, and cilantro. For a milder flavor, opt for a tomato sauce or mild salsa.

taco seasoning

You can make your own taco seasoning by mixing chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and salt. This allows you to control the spice level and avoid preservatives.

shredded cheese (cheddar or mexican blend)

Using freshly shredded cheese rather than pre-shredded can enhance flavor and meltability. If you want a healthier option, consider using low-fat cheese or a dairy-free alternative.

flour tortillas

For a healthier option, use whole wheat or corn tortillas. Ensure the tortillas are warmed slightly before assembling to make them more pliable and prevent tearing.

cooking spray or oil

Use a non-stick cooking spray or a high smoke point oil like canola or avocado oil. For added flavor, consider using olive oil infused with garlic or herbs.

sour cream (optional for serving)

You can substitute Greek yogurt for a healthier alternative that offers a similar tangy flavor. For a vegan option, use a cashew cream or dairy-free sour cream.

fresh cilantro (optional for garnish)

If you're not a fan of cilantro, you can substitute it with fresh parsley or green onions for a fresh garnish. Make sure to chop it finely to distribute the flavor evenly.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Chicken

    Place 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts in the slow cooker.

  • Step 2: Add Salsa and Seasoning

    Pour 1 cup of salsa over the chicken and sprinkle 1 packet of taco seasoning on top. This will infuse the chicken with flavor.

  • Step 3: Cook the Chicken

    Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 4 hours or until the chicken is cooked through and tender. Make sure to check the internal temperature of the chicken; it should reach 165°F (75°C) for safe consumption.

  • Step 4: Shred the Chicken

    After cooking, use two forks to shred the chicken directly in the slow cooker, mixing it with the salsa and seasoning to keep it moist and flavorful.

  • Step 5: Prepare the Skillet

    Spray a skillet with cooking spray or a light drizzle of oil and heat over medium heat. This helps prevent sticking and ensures a crispy quesadilla.

  • Step 6: Assemble the Quesadilla

    Place one flour tortilla in the skillet, add a portion of the shredded chicken mixture, and sprinkle 2 cups of shredded cheese (cheddar or Mexican blend) on top. This combination creates a deliciously gooey quesadilla.

  • Step 7: Cook the Quesadilla

    Top with another tortilla and cook until golden brown on one side (about 2-3 minutes), then carefully flip and cook the other side until the cheese melts and the tortilla is golden brown.

  • Step 8: Repeat the Process

    Continue the process with the remaining tortillas and filling until all quesadillas are cooked.

  • Step 9: Slice and Serve

    Slice the quesadillas into wedges and serve hot, optionally garnished with fresh cilantro and accompanied by sour cream for dipping.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare chicken breasts for cooking?

Start by rinsing the chicken breasts under cold water and patting them dry with paper towels. Trim off any excess fat or gristle with a sharp knife.

What can I use instead of taco seasoning?

If you don't have taco seasoning, you can make your own by mixing chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, and paprika. Use about 1 tablespoon of each for a similar flavor.

How do I know when the chicken is fully cooked?

The chicken is fully cooked when it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). If you don’t have a meat thermometer, ensure the chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear.

What type of cheese should I use for quesadillas?

Cheddar and Mexican blend cheeses are great choices. They melt well and provide good flavor. Feel free to experiment with others like Monterey Jack or Pepper Jack for a spicy kick!

How do I prevent tortillas from sticking to the skillet?

Using cooking spray or a light coat of oil will help prevent sticking. Make sure the skillet is preheated before adding the tortillas.

Can I make these quesadillas ahead of time?

Yes! Prepare the chicken mixture in advance and store it in the fridge. When you're ready to eat, just assemble and cook the quesadillas.

How do I safely shred cooked chicken?

Once the chicken is cooked, allow it to cool for a few minutes. Use two forks to pull the chicken apart gently. This is a great way to shred chicken without burning your hands!

What can I serve with quesadillas?

Quesadillas pair well with sides like guacamole, salsa, or a fresh salad. Sour cream and fresh cilantro are also great for dipping and garnish.

What if I don’t have a slow cooker?

You can use a stovetop pot instead. Simply simmer the chicken, salsa, and taco seasoning on low heat for about 20-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.

How can I make my quesadillas crispy?

To achieve a crispy texture, make sure the skillet is hot enough before adding the quesadilla. Cooking them on medium heat will help achieve that golden brown outside.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a gluten-free option, use corn tortillas instead of flour tortillas. To make it dairy-free, substitute the cheese with a dairy-free cheese alternative and omit the sour cream or use a plant-based sour cream. The dish can easily be made low-carb by using zucchini or cauliflower tortillas.

Pairings

Serve with a side of black beans and corn salad for a refreshing contrast. Pair with a light lager or a fruity margarita to complement the flavors of the quesadillas. For a non-alcoholic option, consider a refreshing agua fresca or a lime-infused sparkling water.

Serving Suggestions

Slice the quesadillas into wedges and arrange them on a colorful platter. Drizzle with extra salsa and sprinkle fresh cilantro on top for a pop of color. Serve with small bowls of sour cream, guacamole, and sliced jalapeños to allow guests to customize their plates. For a festive touch, serve on a vibrant tablecloth with themed decorations for a Mexican fiesta night.

Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Quesadillas

250 min
$10
350 kcal

Description

Delicious, cheesy quesadillas filled with flavorful slow-cooked chicken and spices, perfect for an easy weeknight meal.

Ingredients

  • boneless, skinless chicken breasts: 2
  • salsa: 1 cup
  • taco seasoning: 1 packet
  • shredded cheese (cheddar or mexican blend): 2 cups
  • flour tortillas: 4
  • cooking spray or oil: as needed
  • sour cream (optional for serving): as needed
  • fresh cilantro (optional for garnish): as needed
